Articles.Content:
### WARNING THIS IS A WORK IN PROGRESS ###

Ignoring fuel and engines, this has everything you need for each kind of ship (WIP)

All ships:

Command pod/probe core (It's advisable to add a probe core to every stage for deorbit/control if you decouple by accident)

RTG/solar panel

Battery

Struts, especially near engines

Parachutes (except for orbiters)

Probes:

Scientific equipment

Rovers:

MOAR POWER

Wheels

Lights

Landers:

Landing legs

Orbital Stations:

Large solar panels

COMMAND POD/PROBE CORE. HITCHHIKER DOESN'T PROVIDE CONTROL!!

(Escape pods)

Docking ports

Bases:

Similar to orbital stations

Landing legs/wheels

IF YOU SEE SOMETHING MISSING, PLEASE REPLY BELOW. (Write which categories it applies to please )

Not to be rude, but several people haven't read this properly and comment stuff that's already there!

Edited October 14, 2013 by Javster

Kerbals ! Moar kerbals

They come in the command module.
I think Dispatcher just brought up the most important pieces.
I said at the top, IGNORING FUEL TANKS AND ENGINES.

Struts.

Don't know how many ships I've rushed to the launch pad before strutting it together.

The easiest thing to forget is actually the crew manifest as it resets after each test if you either want to use an odd number of herbals, Either fewer in the default pod to more crew in secondary pods or containers. Next is action groups followed by power.

Power, docking ports, Air intakes (where applicable) and BadS setting on.

And of corse if SCE is set to AUX.

potato?
Idk if you have it, but anyways: MOAR BOOSTERS!!!

I said at the top, IGNORING FUEL TANKS AND ENGINES.

Ya got me on the engines, but you wrote "fuel", not "tanks". (As of edit of 11:55)

Edited October 13, 2013 by Dispatcher
Selecting emoticons.

Staging. then Save before launch

The number of times I'd forgot to set the staging.

Sure you can re stage on the launch pad. But the number of times I had to quick load. and then launched.

Only to realised the staging reset.

RCS tanks

RCS thrusters

I can't tell you how many times they have been forgotten by the Disarming Baton Space Agency.
